titles: Treason rewarded at Tiburn: or, the traitors downfal. Being a full account of the conviction, and condemnation of Ireland, Pickering, and Grove ... as a warning for all traitors, to take example by their fall. To the tune of, Digby's funeral.
publisher: Printed for F. Coles, T. Vere, J. Wright, and J. Clarke,
notes: Place and date of publication from Wing.
Printed in three columns, in black letter.
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
keywords: Political ballads and songs --  England --  17th century.
